intro: Ayenia urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant contains irritant chemicals in its leaves, which can cause a stinging sensation upon contact with the skin. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Ayenia urticifolia plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
